alert.note: Alert for North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 08 at 2:09AM PST until January 08 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Periods of heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches above 3500 feet, except more than 3 feet above 5500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County and North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County above 3500 feet, but especially in the Mount Shasta region. This includes I-5 from Weed south to Dunsmuir, the Mount Shasta Ski Park, Snowman and Dead Horse Summits on Highway 89. It also includes the cities of Bray, Pondosa and Tennant. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible with snow covered roads and limited visibility. Strong winds and the heavy wet snow could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels have lowered down to around Dunsmuir early this morning. Snowfall rates could be 1 inch per hour at times this morning, impacting I-5. Up to a few inches may occur down to elevations around 2500 feet near Dunsmuir. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent or occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County
